Name.label: Non-syndromic diaphragmatic or abdominal wall malformation
Non-syndromic renal or urinary tract malformation
Non-syndromic urogenital tract malformation of male and female
Genetic non-syndromic renal or urinary tract malformation

TextSection.Contents: Exstrophy-Epispadias Complex (EEC) represents a spectrum of genitourinary malformations ranging in severity from epispadias (E) and classical bladder exstrophy (CEB) to exstrophy of the cloaca (EC) as the most severe form (see these terms). Depending on severity, the EEC may involve the urinary system, the musculoskeletal system, the pelvis, the pelvic floor, the abdominal wall, the genitalia and sometimes the spine and the anus.

Name.label: BTNT (broader term maps to a narrower term)
E (exact mapping (the terms and the concepts are equivalent))
